Class Monom

  • java.lang.Object
    • Monom
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    function

    public class Monom
extends java.lang.Object
implements function
    This class represents a simple "Monom" of shape a*x^b, where a is a real number and b is an integer (summed a none negative), see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monomial The class implements function and support simple operations as: construction, value at x, derivative, add and multiply.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Netanel Indik & Eitan Lichtman

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Monom()
      Empty constructor Sets coefficient and power to 0
      Monom(double coefficient, int power)
      Constructor Sets coefficient and power as the user input
      Monom(Monom ot)
      Copy constructor Deep copies given Monom into new Monom.
      Monom(java.lang.String s)
      String constructor set coefficient and power us extracted data from input string.

      • add

        public void add(Monom ot)
         throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        This for adding two Monoms. It will only add Monoms with similar powers. It will add given Monom to this Monom.
        Parameters:
        ot - input Monom
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the Monoms have different powers.

      • multiply

        public void multiply(Monom ot)
        This for multiplying two Monoms. It will multiply this Monom by given Monom.
        Parameters:
        ot - given Monom.

      • derivative

        public void derivative()
        It will change this monom to its derivative.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object ot)
        This for comparing this Monom with given Monom.

        Returns:
        true if given Monom equals this Monom.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This for representing Monom by string in the native writing form. For example the Monom 3*x^0 will represented by "3" etc'.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        string representation of this Monom.
